basics.name: Marsel Atnyashev
basics.label: Developer
basics.summary: I'm a passionate Russia based developer with 6 years of experience from web to app development. In recent years I prefer to use Javascript (react.js, node.js) and Go.

work.summary: Helped the business to be more effecient and reliable using cutting edge technologies.
highlights: created a control panel using React.js
implemented a monitoring system using Node.js with 60% code coverage
developed a backoffice using Polymer and Yii2

work.summary: I co-founded a startup (search engine for government procurements). I wrote it as single page application using React.js which talked to a Go backend that used Postgresql as a store and Sphinx as a search engine.
highlights: services powered by Go and covered with unit tests
web applicaition written in React.js using es6, websockets and web workers
fast search with complex queries using Sphinx
sales via phone and email

work.summary: I developed most of their software from scratch. I was in charge of all the technical problems and hiring coders. The frontend is built with Javascript as a single page application, which talks to a php backend that powered by Mysql and collections of Sphinx servers.
highlights: web application using Google Closure
busy (scaled) full-text search powered by Sphinx
custom web CRM using Require.js, Handlebars, Bootstrap
monitoring servers and services by zabbix
hiring developers

work.summary: I was involved in varios projects: from web to mobile applications and business intelligence.
highlights: improving mobile game website
creation of company's website using MODx
creation a marketing mobile app using PhoneGap (with a control panel for images and text upload)
development of a mobile app for sending sms via the Internet using MoSync C++ SDK
prototypes runing on Marmalade SDK
set up workflow and analytics using Pentaho

work.summary: It was a web-hosting company where I learned the power of regular expressions.
highlights: development of a control panel (Perl, Mysql, HTML+CSS)
development of an internet auction in PHP. I later rewrote it to Perl.
